p_64: Dashes ("-") indicate data for a particular field are not provided for this program in Residency Explorer. Reasons why data are not being provided can vary (e.g., they are not reported or available, they are not applicable, or they are based on an insufficient number of people for reporting purposes).
h3_68: # of Filled Resident Positions, by Year*
p_79: *Totals may vary from year to year due to off-cycle residents.
th_97: # of Residents Who Were Graduates of a Joint MD-PhD program
p_100: Small rural program with close faculty supervision and excellent faculty to resident ratio. Multidisciplinary and subspecialty clinics, include, pediatric dermatology, cosmetic dermatology, CTCL, high risk skin cancer, contact dermatitis, dermatology psychiatry clinic, immunobullous, hidradenitis suppurativa and derm rheum. Excellent continuity experience and surgical exposure. Opportunities in research and clinical trials. Residents consistently are competitive for fellowships.
